content.description:
Make your way up to a ledge and climb a couple of block features to gain the base
of this thin seam. Clip the high bolt to protect the first move then work up and past 2 bolts to the anchor at the base of “It Goes Big”.
Small gear. (Chad)

The route can be set up on TR by climbing  the lower section of Sabbatical.

Left of Sabbatical.
3 bolts, small gear

1) Presence of Thor (Pitch 1) – 5.10b, 4 bolts, 25m. Climb up on a block, follow the crack until it ends, gain the seam to the right,after it ends climb up past 4 bolts to the anchors.

2) Presence of Thor (Pitch 2) – 5.10, 2 bolts, 25m. Hand jam up a crack to gain the shallow, tight right facing corner system. Shares anchors with the top of “Destiny”.

Start at the far left side of the lower trail below a prominent block.
4 bolts

Sabbatical (Pitch 1) – 5.9, 30m. Work your way up the crack system in a left facing corner. This is a good option to gain the ledge to access the upper climbs(head right to bolted anchor at the top of the crack), or continue to bolted anchors and 2nd pitch “Destiny”(stay left in the main crack and climb past the treed ledge). (Chad & Meghan)
-
4) Destiny (Pitch 2) – 5.10+, 25m, 6 bolts. Climb the finger crack to where it tightens up, past 5 bolts. A good selection of small gear is appreciated for this one. (Ted and Chad)
-
5) Buddha’s Belly (Pitch 3) – 5.10+, 20m, 4 bolts. Climb straight up for a couple moves then trend left using seams and ledges. Workup the bulge and past 3 bolts up a couple blocks to the anchor. (Ted and Chad)

The main crack and corner system at the top of the fixed line, slightly hidden behind a tree.
gear to 2, small gear for the Destiny pitch, mixed bolts.

A Terrace gem to be sure. Tons of interesting multi-pitch climbs jammed all into one place

1) Presence of Thor (Pitch 1) – 5.10b, 4 bolts, 25m. Climb up on a block, follow the crack until it ends, gain the seam to the right,after it ends climb up past 4 bolts to the anchors.(Chad & Meghan)
-
2) Presence of Thor (Pitch 2) – 5.10, 2 bolts, 25m. Hand jam up a crack to gain the shallow, tight right facing corner system. Sharesanchors with the top of “Destiny”. (Chad & Meghan)
-
3) Sabbatical (Pitch 1) – 5.9, 30m. Work your way up the crack system in a left facing corner. This is a good option to gain the ledgeto access the upper climbs, or continue to bolted anchors and 2nd pitch “Destiny”. (Chad & Meghan)
-
4) Destiny (Pitch 2) – 5.10+, 25m, 6 bolts. Climb the finger crack to where it tightens up, past 5 bolts. A good selection of small gearis appreciated for this one. (Ted and Chad)
-
5) Buddha’s Belly (Pitch 3) – 5.10+, 20m, 4 bolts. Climb straight up for a couple moves then trend left using seams and ledges. Workup the bulge and past 3 bolts up a couple blocks to the anchor. (Ted and Chad)
-
6) Praying Mantis (Pitch 1) – 5.11+, 25m, 3 bolts. Make your way up to a ledge and climb a couple block features to gain the baseof this thin seam. Clip the high bolt to protect the first move then work up and past 2 bolts to the anchor at the base of “It Goes Big”.
Small gear. (Chad)
-
7) It Goes Big (Pitch 2) – 5.10+, 30m, 7 bolts. Start in the thin seam that gradually widens into an off-width, past 4 bolts to a ledge.Finish up in the left facing corner past three more bolts to anchors at a nice stance. (Chad)
-
8) Tip of the Sword (Pitch 3) – 5.10+, 15m, 3 bolts. Trend up and left past three bolts, as the rock steepens use thin seams for proto a mantle that gains the anchor ledge. Small gear. (Chad)
-
9) The Dull Side – 5.9, 25m, 3 bolts. Climb the right side of the sword to the top, anchors are shared with the top of “It Goes big”.(Chad & Meghan)
-
10)Skeena Solid – 5.11, 20m. Start as for “The Dull Side” then trend right, stemming as long as you can and then thin fingers tothe anchors shared with “Soul Catcher”. (Ted)
-
11)Soul Catcher (Pitch 1) – 5.11, 20m, 3 bolts. Climb into a pocket, then past three bolts into a thin seam that widens into a nicefinger to hand crack. (Chad)
-
12)Judas (Pitch 2) – 5.10+, 20m, 8 bolts. A delicate sport line to the top. (Ted, Ray & Chad)
-
13) Let There Be Rock (Pitch 1) – 5.10a, 20m. Start on the right side of the wall in the corner. Gain the face climbing up thinvertical seams to reach the anchors. (Paul & Chad)
-
14) Let There Be Roll (Pitch 2) – 5.9, 20m, 1 bolt. Up past a large block, which looks to be detached, to a face where the routetrends right past a bolt to gain the ledge with anchors. (Paul & Chad)
